examples: management hired and fired labor in line with demand

verb.description: Obtain the temporary use of (something) for an agreed payment; rent.
examples: she had to hire a dress for the wedding

noun.description: The action of hiring someone or something.
A person who is hired; an employee.
examples: new hires go through six months of training

phrases: Mr Rekshop would like it known that he is available for hire as a deejay.
The hall is available for hire for various activities.
An echo sounder is pretty well essential to find water of the correct depth, and Anders has a good stock of them available for hire.
The CCI also cited examples in the US where off-duty police are available for hire by businesses.
The fact is that these old symbols are available for hire.
origin: Old English hȳrian employ someone for wages, hȳr payment under contract for the use of something, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch huren (verb), huur (noun).
